avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last two days mostly small wind slabs formed especially in places that are protected from the wind. As a consequence of new snow and strong wind they have increased in size on Thursday. These can to an increasing extent be released, even by small loads in isolated cases, but they will be small in most cases, especially on extremely steep slopes. These avalanche prone locations are easy to recognise.
Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.

As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation dry and moist avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they can reach medium size in isolated cases. This applies in particular on very steep sunny slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The weather will be mostly sunny. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard crust. Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some regions 5 to 15 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell on Thursday.
The northeasterly wind has transported the new snow. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.
As a consequence of falling temperatures the snowpack consolidated during the last few days. Towards its surface, the snowpack is hard and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust.
Above approximately 2100 m a lot of snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In some localities a little new snow. Especially along the border with Switzerland, along the border with France and in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent and the danger is slightly greater. The fresh wind slabs are mostly small and to be assessed critically.
The weather will be clear. The backcountry touring conditions are mostly favourable.
As the temperature drops hardly any more moist and wet avalanches are to be expected.
In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The conditions are favourable for backcountry touring. There is a danger of falling on the hard crust.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 2 to 10 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall above approximately 2000 m.

The snowpack is hard and its surface has a melt-freeze crust. The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust will soften during the day. This applies in particular on shady slopes as well as at high altitude.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The weather will be clear. Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was good. The backcountry touring conditions are mostly favourable.
As the temperature drops hardly any more moist and wet avalanches are to be expected.

In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The conditions are favourable for backcountry touring. There is a danger of falling on the hard crust.

snowpackStructure.comment:
In some localities 2 to 5 cm of snow, but less in some localities, fell on Thursday above approximately 2000 m.

The snowpack is hard and its surface has a melt-freeze crust. The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust will soften during the day. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes as well as at low and intermediate altitudes.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.
